structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Facts justifying exclusion of counties from area of regional authority.
law.text:
The governing body of each of the counties in the area of operation of the regional housing authority and the members of the regional housing authority shall adopt a resolution declaring that there is a need for excluding a county or counties from such area if:
Each of the governing bodies of the counties to remain in the area of operation of the regional housing authority and the members of the regional housing authority find that (because of facts arising or determined subsequent to the time when such area first included the county or counties to be excluded) the regional housing authority would be a more efficient or economical administrative unit to carry out the purposes of KRS 80.320 to 80.610 if such county or counties were excluded from such area; and
The governing body of each such county or counties to be excluded and the members of the regional housing authority each also find that (because of the aforesaid changed facts) the purposes of KRS 80.320 to 80.610 could be carried out more efficiently or economically in such county or counties if the area of operation of the regional housing authority did not include such county or counties.
law.history: Amended 1984 Ky. Acts ch. 361, sec. 23, effective July 13, 1984. -- Created 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 70, sec. 6.
